de.exitgames.client.photon
Interface IPhotonPeerListener

public interface IPhotonPeerListener

Callback interface for the Photon client side, to be used when creating a PhotonPeer. These methods are used by your PhotonPeer instance to keep your app updated. Read each method's description and check out the samples to see how to use them.

Author:
developer@exitgames.com

Method Detail

debugReturn

void debugReturn(DebugLevel level,
                 String message)
Provides textual descriptions for various error conditions and noteworthy situations. In cases where the application needs to react, a call to PeerStatusCallback is used. All debug output of the library will be reported through this method. Print it or put it in a buffer to use it on-screen. Use PhotonPeer.DebugOut to select how verbose the output is.

Parameters:
level - Debug level (severity) of the message.
message - Debug text which usually is printed to System.out.

onStatusChanged

void onStatusChanged(StatusCode statusCode)
PeerStatusCallback() is used to denote errors or simply state-changes of the respective PhotonPeer. State change callback When this method is used to signal a state-change, the opCode and other values will be 0 (or null) with the following statusCode values:
  • StatusCode.Connect - the connection to the Photon Server was established
  • StatusCode.Disconnect - the connection was closed (due to Disconnect() or timeout)
  • StatusCode.Exception - some system or network error closed the connection
Possible errors When developing with the Photon API, hundreds of events might reach a client each minute. If they are not processed in time, they might cause issues. As result of this, there are warnings and errors, which should help getting the timing right. Check the StatusCode for a list.

Parameters:
statusCode - status code

onOperationResponse

void onOperationResponse(OperationResponse operationResponse)

onEvent

void onEvent(EventData ev)
